lead_paragraph: Quarterback Trent Green was acquired by Miami last year as part of a plan to turn around the franchise. But in the Dolphins’ first major player purge since Bill Parcells took charge, the team parted ways with Green, wide receiver Marty Booker and seven other players Monday — ushering in the start of what is expected to be a massive off-season roster shake-up. Other notable cuts were offensive tackle L. J. Shelton and the massive defensive tackle Keith Traylor, both of whom were starters.
